item.title: 联合利华向 Arnest 集团出售业务，退出俄罗斯市场
item.description: 联合利华集团（Unilever Plc）将其俄罗斯子公司出售给当地制造商 Arnest Group，在入侵乌克兰两年半多之后退出了俄罗斯。【原文：Unilever Plc sold its Russian subsidiary to local manufacturer Arnest Group, exiting the country more than two-and-a-half years after its invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 中国炼油企业以更窄折扣获得伊朗报价
item.description: 中国的私营炼油厂称，在中东紧张局势加剧、全球投资者人心惶惶之际，伊朗卖家正试图通过缩小折扣来提高价格。【原文：Private oil refiners in China say Iranian sellers are seeking to raise their prices by offering narrower discounts, at a time of elevated tensions in the Middle East that have global investors on edge.】

item.title: 阿布扎比的阿尔达尔公司计划在迪拜世博会附近实施耗资 4.8 亿美元的项目
item.description: 阿布扎比最大的房地产开发商正在计划一个价值 18 亿迪拉姆（约合 4.8 亿美元）的项目，该项目将包括邻近迪拜的住宅、办公楼和零售店，目的是利用中东旅游和商业中心不断增长的需求。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s largest property developer is planning a 1.8 billion dirham ($480 million) project that will include homes, offices and retail locations in neighboring Dubai as it aims to capitalize on rising demand in the Middle East’s tourism and business hub.】

item.title: 乌克兰批准增加税收以满足国防需求的法案
item.description: 乌克兰议会批准了一项法律草案，从今年起增加对个人、公司和银行的税收，以满足增加的军事和国防需求。【原文：The Ukrainian parliament approved a draft law to increase taxes on individuals, companies and banks starting from this year to cover increased military and defense needs.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克计划明年出售 3 亿欧元零售债券
item.description: 斯洛伐克计划在明年第一季度开始向公民出售债券，作为资金来源多元化战略的一部分。【原文：Slovakia plans to begin selling bonds to citizens in the first quarter of next year as part of a strategy to diversify funding sources.】

item.title: 欧洲央行利率决议前，欧元交易员将面临更多痛苦
item.description: 由于交易商押注欧洲央行将在下周降息，期权市场显示欧元出现了自七月以来最严重的单周下跌。【原文：Options markets are flagging the worst weekly retreat for the euro since July, as traders bet the European Central Bank will cut interest rates next week.】

item.title: 日本公用事业公司关闭核反应堆以修复管道
item.description: 日本关西电力公司在管道上发现一个 "微小 "的洞后，将关闭一座核反应堆，并威胁增加化石燃料需求，以填补电力缺口。【原文：Japan’s Kansai Electric Power Co. will shut a nuclear reactor after finding a “tiny” hole in a pipeline, threatening to increase fossil fuel requirements to fill any electricity shortfall.】

item.description: 在 Apple Podcasts 上收听《Odd Lots》在 Spotify 上收听《Odd Lots》订阅时事通讯【原文：Listen to Odd Lots on Apple PodcastsListen to Odd Lots on SpotifySubscribe to the newsletter】

item.title: 超级富豪正在地球上建立一个独立世界
item.description: 近年来，我们看到了一些城市的崛起，它们的主要产业就是如果你很富有，那么它们就是一个居住的好地方。迪拜就是这种态势的典型代表。但不仅仅是迪拜。世界各地的许多城市都是为了迎合富人的需求而存在的，它们的法律和税收制度就像一块磁铁，吸引着全球的财富。那么，这些城市是如何运作的？它们有多大？它们究竟能为全球富人提供什么？在本期播客中，我们将与 Atos【原文：In recent years, we’ve seen the emergence of cities whose main industry is that they’re a great place to live if you’re rich. Dubai would be the ultimate example of this dynamic. But it’s not just Dubai. Lots of cities, all around the world, exist to cater to the wealthy, with a set of laws and taxation schemes that act like a magnet for global wealth. So how do these cities work? How big are they? And what exactly do they offer the global rich? On this episode of the podcast, we speak with Atos】

item.title: 埃尼集团合作伙伴 Agra Energi 探讨出售印尼北甘纳尔天然气区块的股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃尼公司（Eni SpA）的印尼合作伙伴正在探讨以高达 5 亿美元的价格出售其在苏门答腊一个天然气区块的少数股份。【原文：The Indonesian partner of Eni SpA is exploring a sale of its minority stake in a gas block in Sumatra for as much as $500 million, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 捷克通胀率超预期，央行发出谨慎信号
item.description: 上个月，捷克共和国的通胀速度超过了预期，这为捷克央行在降息问题上保持谨慎态度增添了论据。【原文：Inflation in the Czech Republic accelerated more than expected last month, adding to arguments for the central bank to maintain a cautious approach to interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国数据公布前欧洲股市走高；葛兰素史克股价跳涨
item.description: 欧洲股市周四上涨，投资者在等待关键的美国通胀数据，其中医疗保健板块在葛兰素史克公司股价大涨后涨幅居前。【原文：European stocks rose on Thursday as investors awaited key US inflation data, with the healthcare sector leading gains after GSK Plc shares surged.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德斥资 5.57 亿英镑竞购 Tritax Eurobox，超越 Segro
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德公司（Brookfield Corp. ）在收购仓库业主 Tritax EuroBox Plc 公司的竞争中领先于 Segro Plc 公司，建议的现金收购价为 5.57 亿英镑（7.29 亿美元）。【原文：Brookfield Corp. edged ahead of Segro Plc in the battle to buy warehouse landlord Tritax EuroBox Plc with a recommended cash offer that values the company at £557 million ($729 million).】

item.title: 宝马在华销量锐减 30%，德国汽车制造商再遭重创
item.description: 宝马汽车公司第三季度在中国的销售额骤降近 30%，这对这家德国汽车制造商来说是一个新的打击。【原文：BMW AG sales plunged nearly 30% in China in the third quarter, marking a fresh blow for the German carmaker.】

item.title: 香港 ETF 投资者对股市下跌的押注创历史新高
item.description: 香港投资者对在股市下跌时获利的交易所交易基金下了创纪录的赌注，这表明，在经历了突破性反弹之后，市场情绪正在迅速转变。【原文：Investors in Hong Kong have bet a record amount on exchange-traded funds that profit when stocks decline, showing how quickly sentiment is shifting following a breakneck rally.】

item.title: 印度将建造核潜艇、购买无人机以对抗中国
item.description: 熟悉内情的高级官员称，印度将建造两艘核动力潜艇，并购买 31 架美国制造的远程无人机，预计耗资 3,500 亿卢比（约合 42 亿美元），这将有助于对抗中国在该地区的军事主导地位。【原文：India will build two nuclear-powered submarines and buy 31 US-made long-range drones at an estimated cost of 350 billion rupees ($4.2 billion), senior officials familiar with the matter said, helping to counter China’s military dominance in the region.】

item.title: 1,490 亿美元外流后，中国加强对理财产品的检查
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，在投资者为追逐股市涨势而撤资约 1,490 亿美元后，中国已要求其金融机构加强对本国理财产品的监管。【原文：China has asked its financial institutions to beef up monitoring of the nation’s wealth management products, people familiar with the matter said, after investors pulled some $149 billion to chase a rally in stocks.】

item.title: 匈牙利 CPI 降至目标值，央行对降息持谨慎态度
item.description: 匈牙利通胀率放缓至央行的目标，但疲软的货币、日益加剧的地缘政治风险以及今年下半年物价增长加速的预期，可能会使决策者无法继续放松银根。【原文：Hungarian inflation slowed to the central bank’s target but a weak currency, mounting geopolitical risks and an expected acceleration in price-growth in the rest of the year may keep policymakers from continuing monetary easing.】

item.title: 优衣库所有者盈利超预期，2025 财年销售额有望大幅增长
item.description: 日本服装店运营商 Fast Retailing Co. Ltd.在新市场的扩张帮助其抵消了中国市场的放缓，该公司正将 2025 财年的销售目标定得更高。【原文：Fast Retailing Co. is aiming for higher sales in the 2025 fiscal year, after its expansion into newer markets helped the Japanese apparel-store operator offset a slowdown in China.】

item.title: 英国股市价值排名落后于加拿大
item.description: 英国股票市场的上市公司价值正在落后于加拿大，这对伦敦徘徊不前的股票市场造成了又一次打击，近年来，印度等国的股票市场一直在上升，令伦敦股票市场黯然失色。【原文：The UK stock market is falling behind Canada in value of listed companies, dealing yet another blow to London’s meandering equity market, which has been eclipsed by ascending exchanges like India in recent years.】

item.title: 抛售日元是 "最受欢迎的交易"，投资者为 CPI 风险做好准备
item.description: 在投资者准备迎接可能扰乱金融市场的美国月度通胀数据之际，"抛售日本货币 "正成为越来越流行的号召。【原文：“Sell Japan’s currency” is becoming an ever-more popular rallying cry as investors prepare for monthly US inflation data that threaten to roil financial markets.】

item.title: 近半数传统对冲基金涉足加密货币领域
item.description: 据一项新的调查显示，随着监管的日益明朗以及交易所交易基金在美国和亚洲的推出，吸引了更多的投资者进入加密货币资产类别，近一半专注于传统资产类别的对冲基金现在已经涉足加密货币。【原文：Nearly half of hedge funds focused on traditional asset classes now have exposure to cryptocurrencies as increased clarity around regulations and the launch of exchange-traded funds in the U.S. and Asia draw more investors into the asset class, according to a new survey.】

item.title: 世界银行上调增长最快地区的增长预测
item.description: 世界银行上调了今年南亚地区的经济增长预期，理由是印度的国内需求更加强劲，而且该地区其他地方的经济复苏速度也更快。【原文：The World Bank raised its economic growth forecast for South Asia for this year, citing stronger domestic demand in India and faster recoveries elsewhere in the region.】

item.title: 波兰扎布卡公司 IPO 定价最高，将筹资 16 亿美元
item.description: 欧洲最大的连锁便利店 Zabka Group SA 首次公开募股的定价为拟议区间的最高价，成为四年来华沙最大的一次上市。【原文：The initial public offering of Europe’s largest chain of convenience stores, Zabka Group SA, is priced at the top of a proposed range, making it the biggest listing in Warsaw in four years.】

item.title: 石油上涨，交易商关注中东局势，同时库存攀升
item.description: 由于交易商在关注以色列对伊朗上周初导弹袭击的回应，同时美国原油库存创下 4 月以来最大增幅，石油在连续两天下跌后走高。【原文：Oil edged higher after a two-day decline as traders watched for an Israeli response to Iran’s missile attack early last week, while US crude stockpiles expanded the most since April.】

item.title: 高盛称对冲基金周二抛售中国股票创历史新高
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc. ）的交易员报告称，对冲基金周二卖出了创纪录数量的中国股票。【原文：Hedge funds sold a record amount of Chinese shares on Tuesday after a weeklong holiday that lacked more major stimulus, according to a Goldman Sachs Group Inc. trader note.】

item.title: 德国电信宣布回购高达 20 亿欧元的股票
item.description: 德国电信公司（Deutsche Telekom AG）表示，计划在 2025 年提出一项高达 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）的回购计划，并将增加股息。【原文：Deutsche Telekom AG said it plans to propose a buyback program of as much as €2 billion ($2.2 billion) for 2025 and will increase its dividend.】
